TSF-LAPLACETRANSFORMS MATH2014:MATHEMATICSII(Engineering) PreliminaryworkLaplacetransform TwoimportantpropertiesoftheLaplacetransform: Theorem TheLaplacetransformislinear,i.e.,iff(t)andg(t)are functionsandcanddareconstants,then L[cf(t)+dg(t)]=cL[f(t)]+dL[g(t)]. Proof Bydeﬁnition, L[cf(t)+dg(t)] = Z1 0 e�st(cf(t)+dg(t))dt =c Z1 0 e�stf(t)dt+d Z1 0 e�stg(t)dt =cL[f(t)]+dL[g(t)],asdesired. TSF-LAPLACETRANSFORMS MATH2014:MATHEMATICSII(Engineering) PreliminaryworkLaplacetransform Question Wehaveseenthatforagivenfunctionf(t),sometimes L[f(t)]doesnotexist.WhenareweguaranteedthatL[f(t)] exists? Deﬁnition Afunctionf(t)isofexponentialorder↵ifthereexist constants↵,M>0andT>0suchthat |f(t)|Me↵tforallt>T. Roughlyspeakingfisofexponentialorder↵iffdoesnot increasefasterthane↵tast!1. Wearenowreadytoanswerthequestionabove. Theorem TheLaplacetransformoff(t)existsfors>aprovided 1 RT 0f(t)dtexistsforallT>0,and 2 f(t)isofexponentialorder. Sinceby(2),f(t)isofexponentialorder,thereexistconstants K,aandT0suchthat f(t)<Keatforallt>T0. Notethat L[f(t)]= ZT0 0 e�stf(t)dt+ Z1 T0 e�stf(t)dt. From|f(t)|<Keatforallt>T0,weget |e�stf(t)|<e�st·Keat=Ke�(s�a)t. Bydirectintegration,weseethatR1 T0K·e�(s�a)tdtconverges fors>aandsobytheComparisonTest,R1 T0e�stf(t)dt converges.HencethesumL[f(t)]=R1 0 e�stf(t)dtconverges asdesired.
